content: ELISA kit testing for detecting the infectious disease
Prepare and check anesthetic and monitoring machine(s)
Maintain and monitor the patient(s) during anesthetic process
Vaginoscopy using a vaginal speculum or endoscopy - Female dog
Vaginal smear - Female dog or cat
Place and secure an intravenous [intraosseous] catheter
Understand basics of and operate the diagnostic X-ray equipment
Utilize the radiographic exposure factors to obtain diagnostic radiographs
Understand and evaluate the radiographic quality
Recognize and correct the radiographic artifacts
Understand and utilize the radiographic positioning of routine anatomic areas
Understand basic principles of other imaging modalities including CT and MRI
Understand and apply the radiation safety measures

Understand basics of radiographic evaluation and interpret the topic areas of cardiac and non-cardiac thorax, abdomen, GI, musculoskeletal, neuroradiology and special procedures. Effectively communicate radiographic findings in writing and verbally
Generate appropriate differential DX lists for radiographic abnormalities in light of the clinical presentation
Appropriately manage cases in light of radiographic findings to include follow-up diagnostics and therapy
Integrate history, signalment, imaging, diagnosis and pathophysiology of case
Understand the role of imaging in case management - strengths and weaknesses
Measure PCV and Total Protein with a microhematocrit tube
Make a diagnostic blood smear (must be evaluated by clinical pathology faculty member or staff)
Make a diagnostic urinalysis (must be evaluated by clinical pathology faculty member or staff)
Make a diagnostic smear of a fine needle aspirate sample (must be evaluated by clinical pathology faculty member or staff)
Correctly operate a microscope (must be evaluated by clinical pathology faculty member or staff)
Perform fine needle aspiration or biopsy of tissue
Place and secure an intravenous catheter
Set up and maintain IV fluid delivery system
Obtain urine sample using appropriate technique
Handle and label collected samples safely and collectly select sample tubes and transport methods
Observation to apply bandages used in veterinary orthopedics
